label: Anxiety Disorders
description: Mental health disorders characterized by feelings of worry, anxiety, or fear that are strong enough to interfere with daily activities

label: Bipolar Disorder
description: A mental health condition that causes extreme mood swings that include emotional highs (mania or hypomania) and lows (depression)

label: Chronic Adjustment Disorder
description: A stress-related condition that occurs when a person has difficulty coping with a stressful life event for an extended period

label: Depression
description: A mental health disorder characterized by persistently depressed mood or loss of interest in activities, causing significant impairment in daily life

label: Eating Disorders
description: Serious conditions related to persistent eating behaviors that negatively impact health, emotions, and ability to function in important areas of life

label: Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD)
description: A mental health disorder characterized by uncontrollable, reoccurring thoughts (obsessions) and/or behaviors (compulsions) that a person feels the urge to repeat

label: Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)
description: A mental health condition triggered by experiencing or witnessing a terrifying event, causing flashbacks, nightmares, and severe anxiety

label: Schizophrenia
description: A chronic and severe mental disorder that affects how a person thinks, feels, and behaves, often experiencing reality abnormally

label: Hypertension
description: A chronic medical condition in which the blood pressure in the arteries is persistently elevated

label: Ischemic Heart Disease
description: A condition characterized by reduced blood supply to the heart muscle, usually due to coronary artery disease

label: Heart Arrhythmia
description: An irregular heartbeat or abnormal heart rhythm, where the heart beats too fast, too slow, or erratically

label: Bruxism
description: A condition characterized by excessive teeth grinding or jaw clenching, often occurring during sleep

label: Colon Cancer
description: A type of cancer that begins in the large intestine (colon), the final part of the digestive tract

label: Esophageal Cancer
description: Cancer that occurs in the esophagus, a long, hollow tube that runs from the throat to the stomach

label: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD)
description: A digestive disorder that occurs when stomach acid frequently flows back into the esophagus

label: Hemorrhoids
description: Swollen veins in the lowest part of the rectum and anus, often causing discomfort and bleeding

label: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
description: A common disorder that affects the large intestine, causing abdominal pain, cramping, bloating, and changes in bowel movements

label: Ageusia and Anosmia (Loss of taste and smell)
description: Conditions characterized by the loss of taste (ageusia) and smell (anosmia), which can significantly impact quality of life

label: Glaucoma
description: A group of eye conditions that damage the optic nerve, often caused by abnormally high pressure in the eye

label: Meniere's Disease
description: An inner ear disorder that can cause vertigo, hearing loss, tinnitus, and a feeling of fullness in the ear

label: Partial or severe hearing loss (tinnitus)
description: Reduction in the ability to hear, often accompanied by tinnitus (ringing in the ears)

label: Vertigo
description: A sensation of feeling off balance or that you or your surroundings are spinning or moving

label: Tinnitus
description: The perception of noise or ringing in the ears when no external sound is present, often described as a ringing, buzzing, hissing, or whistling sound

label: Diabetes
description: A group of diseases that result in too much sugar in the blood (high blood glucose)

label: Hypothyroidism
description: A condition in which the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormone, leading to various symptoms

label: Kidney Stones
description: Hard deposits made of minerals and salts that form inside the kidneys, causing pain when passing through the urinary tract

label: Urinary Incontinence
description: Loss of bladder control, ranging from occasionally leaking urine to having an uncontrollable urge to urinate

label: Uterine Fibroids
description: Noncancerous growths of the uterus that often appear during childbearing years

label: Ankle
description: Various conditions affecting the ankle joint, including sprains, strains, arthritis, and instability, which can cause pain, swelling, and limited mobility

label: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
description: A complicated disorder characterized by extreme fatigue that can't be explained by any underlying medical condition

label: Bone Spurs
description: Bony projections that develop along bone edges, often where bones meet each other in joints

label: Bulging or Herniated Disc
description: A condition where a disc in the spine protrudes or ruptures, potentially causing pain and nerve compression

label: Carpal Tunnel
description: A condition that causes numbness, tingling, and weakness in the hand and arm due to pressure on the median nerve in the wrist

label: Cervical Strain
description: An injury to the muscles and tendons in the neck, often caused by sudden movements or prolonged poor posture

label: Chronic Back Pain
description: Persistent pain in the back lasting for more than 12 weeks, often without a clear cause

label: Fibromyalgia
description: A disorder characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain accompanied by fatigue, sleep, memory and mood issues

label: Flatfeet
description: A condition in which the arch of the foot collapses, with the entire sole of the foot coming into contact with the ground

label: Gout
description: A form of inflammatory arthritis characterized by sudden, severe attacks of pain, swelling, redness and tenderness in joints

label: Hallux Valgus
description: A foot deformity where the big toe points toward the second toe, causing a bump on the side of the foot

label: Hip Pain
description: Discomfort in or around the hip joint, which can be caused by various conditions including arthritis, bursitis, or injuries

label: Knee Pain
description: Pain in or around the knee joint, which can be caused by injuries, mechanical problems, types of arthritis, or other conditions

label: Lumbar Strain
description: An injury to the lower back, specifically to the muscles, tendons, and ligaments in the lumbar region

label: Plantar fasciitis
description: Inflammation of the plantar fascia, a thick band of tissue that connects the heel bone to the toes, causing heel pain

label: Rheumatoid Arthritis
description: An autoimmune disorder that causes inflammation of the joints and surrounding tissues, often affecting multiple joints

label: Scoliosis
description: A sideways curvature of the spine that most often occurs during the growth spurt just before puberty

label: Shin Splints
description: Pain along the shin bone (tibia) — the large bone in the front of your lower leg

label: Shoulder Rotator Cuff Tear
description: A tear in one or more of the tendons surrounding the shoulder joint, causing pain and reduced range of motion

label: Spinal Stenosis
description: A narrowing of the spaces within your spine, which can put pressure on the nerves that travel through the spine

label: Tendonitis
description: Inflammation or irritation of a tendon, often caused by repetitive movements or sudden injury

label: TMJ
description: Temporomandibular joint disorders, causing pain and dysfunction in the jaw joint and muscles controlling jaw movement

label: CRPS
description: Complex Regional Pain Syndrome, a chronic pain condition that most often affects one limb after an injury or trauma

label: Migraines
description: A neurological condition that can cause intense, debilitating headaches often accompanied by other symptoms

label: Peripheral Neuropathy
description: A result of damage to the peripheral nerves, often causing weakness, numbness and pain in hands and feet

label: Radiculopathy
description: A condition due to a compressed nerve in the spine that can cause pain, numbness, tingling, or weakness along the course of the nerve

label: Restless Leg Syndrome
description: A condition that causes an uncontrollable urge to move your legs, usually due to an uncomfortable sensation

label: Sciatica
description: Pain that radiates along the path of the sciatic nerve, which branches from your lower back through your hips and buttocks and down each leg

label: Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI)
description: A disruption in the normal function of the brain that can be caused by a bump, blow, or jolt to the head

label: Allergic Rhinitis
description: Inflammation of the nasal passages caused by an allergic reaction, often resulting in symptoms similar to a cold

label: Lung Nodules
description: Small masses of tissue in the lung that appear as round, white shadows on a chest X-ray or CT scan

label: Mesothelioma
description: A type of cancer that develops in the thin layer of tissue that covers many of the internal organs (mesothelium)

label: Sinusitis
description: Inflammation or swelling of the tissue lining the sinuses, often causing difficulty breathing through the nose

label: Sleep Apnea
description: A potentially serious sleep disorder in which breathing repeatedly stops and starts during sleep

label: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
description: A chronic inflammatory lung disease that causes obstructed airflow from the lungs

label: Eczema
description: A condition that makes your skin red and itchy, often occurring in children but can occur at any age

label: Scars
description: Marks left on the skin after a wound or injury has healed

label: Squamous Cell Carcinoma
description: A common form of skin cancer that develops in the squamous cells that make up the middle and outer layers of the skin

label: Tinea Pedis
description: A fungal infection of the foot, commonly known as athlete's foot

label: Psoriasis
description: A condition that causes the body to make new skin cells in days rather than weeks, resulting in thick, scaly patches

label: Insomnia
description: A common sleep disorder that can make it hard to fall asleep, hard to stay asleep, or cause you to wake up too early and not be able to get back to sleep

label: Cancer
description: A disease in which some of the body's cells grow uncontrollably and spread to other parts of the body

label: Erectile Dysfunction
description: The inability to get or keep an erection firm enough for sexual intercourse
